com.WAT.airbnb.rest.admin

Class AdminControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.WAT.airbnb.rest.admin.AdminControl

  • @Path(value="/admin")
public class AdminControl
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles all operations for the admin Paths: /verifytoken /getusers /alteruser/{userId} /approve/{userId} /get/{userId} /rawexport

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AdminControl() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response alterUser(int userId, java.lang.String json)
      Alters the given user (specified by the userId) according to the given JSON string
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response approve(int userId, java.lang.String token)
      Approves the specified userID for renting their house
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response exportRaw(java.lang.String token)
      When the administrator requests an XML export, a temporary export.xml file is created in the filesystem and a token is issued with an expiration time of 2 seconds.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getApprovalList(java.lang.String token)
      Returns a list of only the users that have not yet been approved
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getApprove(java.lang.String token)
      Returns a list of all the users in the database (Minified)
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getUser(int userId, java.lang.String token)
      Returns the full info about the specified user
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getXml(java.lang.String t)
      Authenticates the provided token and returns the xml file as an output stream.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response login(UserCredentialBean bean)
      Tries to match the provided credentials against the database and returns the corresponding response
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response verifyToken(java.lang.String token)
      Verifies the given token

      • exportRaw

        @Path(value="/rawexport")
 @POST
 @Consumes(value="text/plain")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response exportRaw(java.lang.String token)
        When the administrator requests an XML export, a temporary export.xml file is created in the filesystem and a token is issued with an expiration time of 2 seconds. The client then sends a GET request (through the URL) to /admin/getxml supplying the previously issued token.

      • getXml

        @Path(value="/getxml")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="application/xml")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getXml(@QueryParam(value="t")
                                                                                                         java.lang.String t)
        Authenticates the provided token and returns the xml file as an output stream. Also deletes the file after it has been successfully sent. Format: 
              
          <xml>
              <Airbnb>
                  <Users>
                      <User>
                          <UserID>{userId}</UserID>
                          ...
                      </User>
                      ...
                  </Users>
                  <Houses>
                      <House>
                          <HouseID>{houseId}</HouseID>
                          ...
                      </House>
                      ...
                  </Houses>
                  <Comments>
                      <Comment>
                          <CommentID>{commentId}</CommentID>
                          ...
                      </Comment>
                      ...
                  </Comments>
                  &Messages>
                      <Message>
                          <MessageID>{messageId}</MessageID>
                          ...
                      </Message>
                      ...
                  </Messages>
                  <Bookings>
                      <Booking>
                          <BookingID>{bookingId}</BookingID>
                          ...
                      </Booking>
                      ...
                  </Bookings>
              </Airbnb>
          </xml>
        Parameters:
        t -
